availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Humphrey Mooar (Covington, Kentucky, attorney and judge)

body.p: Covington, Kentucky, attorney and judge. New Hampshire native. Son of Gardner Mooar and Mary Hardy Marden Mooar. Married to Phoebe Flagg Mooar. Father of Charles Mooar, Sarah Mooar, Mary Mooar, and Evie Mooar. Graduated from Dartmouth College in 1848. Teacher in Louisiana from 1848 to 1849. Judge of the Kenton County Court from 1858 to 1862. Attorney in Covington in 1860.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 5, p. 254; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 8, p. 15; Marvin Davis Bisbee, Dartmouth College: Necrology, 1898-99 (Hanover, N.H.: Dartmouth Press, 1899), 16-17; Find A Grave, "Judge Charles Humphrey Mooar (1822-1898)," Memorial #78718313, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=78718313&ref=acom (accessed May 23, 2017).
